resetwelcome_description: Resets the welcome message to the bot's default welcome message.
setwelcome_description: Set the welcome message to the specified message. For help with formatting, see /welcomeformat.
welcome_description: Toggles the welcome message on or off.
welcome_mode_disable: The welcome message for {chat_title} is now disabled.
welcome_mode_enable: The welcome message for {chat_title} is now enabled.
welcome_reset: The welcome message for {chat_title} has been set back to the bot's default welcome message.
welcome_set_empty: You must specify the welcome message, e.g.: /setwelcome your welcome message. For help with formatting, click here.
welcome_set_error: There was an error and the welcome message could not be set. Error: {error}
welcome_set_success: The welcome message for {chat_title} has been set successfully.
welcome_format_help_msg: The message can be formatted in html format or with Telegram's builtin text formatter. You can use the /html command to verify that your html is correct. You can use these arguments for the welcome message: - {id} to show the user ID in the welcome message. - {username} to show the user's username in the welcome message. if the user has no username the bot shows a mention. - {first_name} to show the user's name in the welcome message. - {full_name} or {name} to show the user's full name in the welcome message. - {mention} to mention the user in the welcome message. - {chat_title} or {title} to show the chat title in the welcome message. - {count} to show the chat members count in the welcome message. To add buttons you can use [button text](buttonurl:button link). To add more buttons on the same line, you can add :same after the link, like this: [button text](buttonurl:button link:same).
welcomeformat_description: Help you format the welcome message.
